Package main

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • main.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    public class Game
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener
    Manages the game. (all components of the game, the turn cycle of the game, all game logic, game GUI and game view)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      private void addCars()
      Adds all cars to the game.
      private void addComponents()
      Adds all components to the game in correct order so the correct ones are in the foreground and the background.
      private void addCrosshair()
      Adds the crosshair (used to get input from human players) to the game.
      private void addGUI()
      Adds the JLabel showing the turn count, the JButton used to go back to menu and the JLabel displaying the controls.
      private boolean allCarsIdle()
      Returns true if all cars are finished or sunk.
      private void checkForCheckpoint​(int x, int y)
      Checks whether the tile is checkpoint and saves that the car has passed this checkpoint using the Checkpoint.carPassed() if so.
      private void checkForFinish​(Car car, int x, int y)
      Checks whether the tile is finish and if the car has passed all checkpoints.
      private void checkForSand​(Car car, int x, int y)
      Checks whether the tile is sand and sets the car velocity vector to (0;0) using the Car.setVelocity(int[] velocity) method if so.
      private void checkForSpecialTiles​(Car car, int x, int y)
      Calls all methods which check for special tiles.
      private void checkForWater​(Car car, int x, int y)
      Checks whether the tile is water and sets the car as "sunk" using the Car.sunk() method if so.
      private void checkTile​(Car car, int x, int y)
      Checks whether the tile is rideable using the Map.isTileRideable() method and moves the car there or calls the onCarCrash() method accordingly.
      private void drive​(Car car, int[] a)
      Changes the velocity vector of the car according to the move made by the player given to this method as the int[] a parameter using the Car.accelerate(int[] a) method and calls the goThroughPath() method to make the car travel through the path it is to take this turn according to its velocity vector tile by tile.
      private void endRace()
      Is called when the race is finished.
      int getTileSize()
      Returns the size of one tile of the map in pixels.
      private void goThroughPath​(Car car)
      Finds the straightest symmetrical path from the current location of the car to the target location.
      private void hideCH()
      Hides the crosshair.
      private void hideScore()
      Hides the post-game score board.
      boolean humanOnTurn()
      Returns true if human player is on turn.
      private void init()
      Initializes the JPanel attributes of Game.
      private void initCars​(java.util.ArrayList<CarPanel> carPanels)
      Initializes all cars and uses AICompiler to compile and get instances of all AIs for the cars.
      private void initCheckpoints​(int numberOfCars)
      Finds all CHECKPOINT tiles on the map and initializes checkpoints.
      private void initCrosshair()
      Initializes crosshair used to get input from the user for the human-controlled cars.
      private void initGUI()
      Initializes the JLabel showing the turn count, the JButton used to go back to menu and the JLabel displaying the controls.
      private void initMap​(java.lang.String mapName)
      Initializes the map.
      private void initRace()
      Calls the init() method of each AI in the game and then calls the nextTurn() method to start the first turn of the first player.
      private void initScorePanel()
      Initializes the JPanel used to show post-game score.
      void keyPressed​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
      Is called when a key on the keyboard is pressed.
      void keyReleased​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)  
      void keyTyped​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)  
      private void moveActiveCarToForeground()
      Moves the activeCar to the foreground so it is not covered up by other cars.
      private void moveCar​(Car car, int x, int y)
      Moves the given car to the given coordinates.
      private void moveCarsToStart()
      Relocates all cars to the start.
      private void moveCH​(int x, int y)
      Moves the crosshair to the given coordinates.
      private void moveGUI()
      Moves the GUI elements to the correct positions.
      private boolean nextAiMoveValid()
      Determines whether the move AI made when its drive() method was called is valid.
      private void nextCar()
      Keeps calling the rotateCar() method until the activeCar is a car which has not finished or sunk yet.
      private void nextTurn()
      Is called when a new turn is to begin (turn is treated here as one move of one player).
      private void onCarCrash​(Car car)
      Sets the velocity vector of the car to (0;0).
      void onCHClick​(int[] index)
      Is called when crosshair is clicked.
      private void rotateCar()
      Rotates activeCarIndex and activeCar to the next car.
      private void showCH()
      Shows the crosshair.
      private void showNextAiMove​(boolean b)
      Shows or hides the red highlight of the next AI move on the crosshair.
      private void showScore()
      Shows the post-game score board.
      private void updateTurnCount()
      Updates the text of JPanel turnLabel to show the correct value.
      private void updateView()
      Repaint components of the game with correct sizes and positions.

      • Game

        Game​(Menu menu)
throws java.io.IOException,
     StartNotFoundException,
     org.xml.sax.SAXException,
     javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
        Initializes the game with information gathered with get-methods of the menu instance given to it as parameter. Calls other init-methods to initialize different parts of the game.
        Parameters:
        menu - the instance of Menu from which the game should gather information to initialize the game.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        StartNotFoundException - thrown if there is no start on the map or there is more than one.
        org.xml.sax.SAXException
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
        See Also:
        Menu, init(), initCrosshair(), initCars(ArrayList), initMap(String), initScorePanel(), initGUI(), addComponents(), moveCarsToStart(), initCheckpoints(int), initRace()

        private void initCheckpoints​(int numberOfCars)
        Finds all CHECKPOINT tiles on the map and initializes checkpoints. Treats more CHECKPOINT tiles next to each other as one checkpoint.
        Parameters:

      • initRace

        private void initRace()
        Calls the init() method of each AI in the game and then calls the nextTurn() method to start the first turn of the first player.
        See Also:
        DriverAI.init(Tile[][]), nextTurn()

      • nextTurn

        private void nextTurn()
        Is called when a new turn is to begin (turn is treated here as one move of one player). Calls itself recursively to maintain the turn cycle. Cycles through cars so different one is on turn each time. Increases the turn count by one every time the game cycles through all cars. Determines whether a human or an AI is on turn. If an AI is on turn, calls its drive() method to determine its next move, checks if the move made by AI is valid, shows it by highlighting the corresponding crosshair tile and waits for the user to press ENTER (see keyPressed() method), which calls the drive() method and then calls nextTurn() again. If a human is on turn, waits for the crosshair to be clicked (see onCHClick() method), which calls the drive() method and then calls nextTurn() again. Calls the endRace() method to end the race when all cars are finished or sunk or the turn-max is reached.
        See Also:
        updateTurnCount(), nextCar(), nextAiMoveValid(), keyPressed(KeyEvent), onCHClick(int[]), drive(Car, int[]), endRace(), DriverAI.drive(int[], int[], Tile[][])

      • nextAiMoveValid

        private boolean nextAiMoveValid()
        Determines whether the move AI made when its drive() method was called is valid.
        Returns:
        true if nextAiMove is a valid move.
        See Also:
        DriverAI.drive(int[], int[], Tile[][])

      • onCHClick

        public void onCHClick​(int[] index)
        Is called when crosshair is clicked. Calls drive() method and passes the index of the crosshair tile clicked received as parameter. The crosshair index corresponds to the acceleration vector, which is to be added to the velocity vector of the car. Then calls nextTurn() to start the next turn.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the clicked crosshair tile.
        See Also:
        CrosshairTile.mouseClicked(MouseEvent), drive(Car, int[]), nextTurn()

      • keyTyped

        public void keyTyped​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Specified by:
        keyTyped in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Is called when a key on the keyboard is pressed. MINUS and PLUS keys zoom in and out of the game view. When ENTER is pressed, if AI is on turn and waiting for the user, the turn of the AI is performed by calling the drive() method and nextTurn() method is called to begin the next turn.
        Specified by:
        keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:
        e -
        See Also:
        drive(Car, int[]), nextTurn()

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Specified by:
        keyReleased in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

      • drive

        private void drive​(Car car,
                   int[] a)
        Changes the velocity vector of the car according to the move made by the player given to this method as the int[] a parameter using the Car.accelerate(int[] a) method and calls the goThroughPath() method to make the car travel through the path it is to take this turn according to its velocity vector tile by tile.
        Parameters:
        car - the car which is to be driven.
        a - the acceleration vector which is to be added to the velocity vector of the car before it is driven.
        See Also:
        Car.accelerate(int[]), goThroughPath(Car)

      • goThroughPath

        private void goThroughPath​(Car car)
        Finds the straightest symmetrical path from the current location of the car to the target location. (target location = current location + car velocity vector) The car can move to any adjacent tile including diagonal ones. Car then moves tile by tile through the path. checkTile() method is called for each tile the car moves over to determine if the car can move there and if any special actions are to be made on that tile. Stops going through tiles if the car crashes (drives into a wall) or sinks (drives into water).
        Parameters:
        car - the car which is to change its position by adding its velocity vector to it and go through all tiles in the path.
        See Also:
        Car, checkTile(Car, int, int)

      • checkTile

        private void checkTile​(Car car,
                       int x,
                       int y)
        Checks whether the tile is rideable using the Map.isTileRideable() method and moves the car there or calls the onCarCrash() method accordingly. Calls the checkForSpecialTiles() method to check if any special actions are to be made on this tile.
        Parameters:
        car - the car which is to be moved to the tile or crashed depending on the type of the tile.
        x - the X coordinate of the tile which is to be checked.
        y - the Y coordinate of the tile which is to be checked.
        See Also:
        Map.isTileRideable(int, int), moveCar(Car, int, int), onCarCrash(Car)

      • onCarCrash

        private void onCarCrash​(Car car)
        Sets the velocity vector of the car to (0;0). Calls the car.crashed() method. Sets boolean stop to true to stop the goThroughPath() method from going through any more tiles.
        Parameters:
        car - the car that crashed.
        See Also:
        Car.setVelocity(int[]), Car.crashed()

      • checkForSpecialTiles

        private void checkForSpecialTiles​(Car car,
                                  int x,
                                  int y)
        Calls all methods which check for special tiles.
        Parameters:
        car - the car which has driven over the tile and which will be affected by the special actions if there are any on the tile.
        x - the X coordinate of the tile which is to be checked for special actions.
        y - the Y coordinate of the tile which is to be checked for special actions.
        See Also:
        checkForCheckpoint(int, int), checkForFinish(Car, int, int), checkForSand(Car, int, int), checkForWater(Car, int, int)

      • checkForCheckpoint

        private void checkForCheckpoint​(int x,
                                int y)
        Checks whether the tile is checkpoint and saves that the car has passed this checkpoint using the Checkpoint.carPassed() if so.
        Parameters:
        x - the X coordinate of the tile which is to be checked.
        y - the Y coordinate of the tile which is to be checked.
        See Also:
        Checkpoint, Checkpoint.carPassed(int)

      • checkForFinish

        private void checkForFinish​(Car car,
                            int x,
                            int y)
        Checks whether the tile is finish and if the car has passed all checkpoints. Calls the Car.finished() method and creates new instance of CarPanel to display the score for the finished car.
        Parameters:
        car - the car which had driven over the tile.
        x - the X coordinate of the tile which is to be checked.
        y - the Y coordinate of the tile which is to be checked.
        See Also:
        Car.finished(), CarPanel

      • checkForSand

        private void checkForSand​(Car car,
                          int x,
                          int y)
        Checks whether the tile is sand and sets the car velocity vector to (0;0) using the Car.setVelocity(int[] velocity) method if so.
        Parameters:
        car - the car which has driven over the tile.
        x - the X coordinate of the tile which is to be checked.
        y - the Y coordinate of the tile which is to be checked.
        See Also:
        Car.setVelocity(int[])

      • checkForWater

        private void checkForWater​(Car car,
                           int x,
                           int y)
        Checks whether the tile is water and sets the car as "sunk" using the Car.sunk() method if so. (Sunk car cannot continue the race and is DQed.)
        Parameters:
        car - the car which has driven over the tile.
        x - the X coordinate of the tile which is to be checked.
        y - the Y coordinate of the tile which is to be checked.
        See Also:
        Car.sunk()

      • moveCar

        private void moveCar​(Car car,
                     int x,
                     int y)
        Moves the given car to the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        car - the car to be moved.
        x - the X coordinate to which the car is to be moved.
        y - the Y coordinate to which the car is to be moved.
        See Also:
        Car

      • moveCH

        private void moveCH​(int x,
                    int y)
        Moves the crosshair to the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - the X coordinate to which the crosshair is to be moved.
        y - the Y coordinate to which the crosshair is to be moved.
        See Also:
        CrosshairTile

      • showCH

        private void showCH()
        Shows the crosshair.
        See Also:
        CrosshairTile

      • hideCH

        private void hideCH()
        Hides the crosshair.
        See Also:
        CrosshairTile

      • showNextAiMove

        private void showNextAiMove​(boolean b)
        Shows or hides the red highlight of the next AI move on the crosshair.
        Parameters:
        b - the boolean to which is the value of visibility of the highlight to be set.
        See Also:
        CrosshairTile.setIsNextAiMove(boolean)

      • allCarsIdle

        private boolean allCarsIdle()
        Returns true if all cars are finished or sunk.
        Returns:
        true if all cars are finished or sunk

      • nextCar

        private void nextCar()
        Keeps calling the rotateCar() method until the activeCar is a car which has not finished or sunk yet. Then calls moveActiveCarToForeground() method.
        See Also:
        rotateCar(), moveActiveCarToForeground()

      • rotateCar

        private void rotateCar()
        Rotates activeCarIndex and activeCar to the next car.

      • moveActiveCarToForeground

        private void moveActiveCarToForeground()
        Moves the activeCar to the foreground so it is not covered up by other cars.

      • endRace

        private void endRace()
        Is called when the race is finished. Adds score panels for all cars which have not been able to finish the race. Shows the post-game score board.
        See Also:
        ScorePanel, showScore()

      • humanOnTurn

        public boolean humanOnTurn()
        Returns true if human player is on turn.
        Returns:
        true if human player is on turn.

      • updateTurnCount

        private void updateTurnCount()
        Updates the text of JPanel turnLabel to show the correct value.

      • updateView

        private void updateView()
        Repaint components of the game with correct sizes and positions.

      • moveGUI

        private void moveGUI()
        Moves the GUI elements to the correct positions.

      • getTileSize

        public int getTileSize()
        Returns the size of one tile of the map in pixels.
        Returns:
        the size of one tile of the map in pixels.

      • showScore

        private void showScore()
        Shows the post-game score board.

      • hideScore

        private void hideScore()
        Hides the post-game score board.
